node.title: Travel to Mawlynnong and Dawki in Shillong, Meghalaya
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
Mawlynnong is widely regarded as the cleanest village in Asia whereas Dawki is on the border of Meghalaya with Bangladesh. It's on a hill and we can see the plains of Bangladesh all along the route to Dawki.

![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmQ7tquiF9Pi7i8cyT9subQDGrXHSJKU6mPirEsoLZqnT9/image.png)

node.title: Earn Money While Travelling In India
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
First thing will be to get out from the addiction of monthly salary, That’s the one thing which stops us to travel.
As a traveler, the last thing you need to worry about should be excess of money( which will eventually end up in your bank account without giving much in return) on the other hand traveling will make you rich, with all the experiences & stories you will return with.

There are plenty of ways to travel India while earning money. Let’s start with our approach-

Decide the states you want to cover first, you can’t travel all the places in one go. So we need to have a list of top 4-5 places you want to see in order.

Now when you know what you want to explore first, do a little bit of research over that place(rent books from library or just surf over the internet). Continue this activity for your first place for about a week.

Keep a note that to cover a place completely, You have to stay there for around 3 months to explore it completely. Don’t be a tourist, be a traveler.

Now when you know what to expect from the place you are going to land into, I assume you know the cheapest way to travel & stay. So reach the place & stay in any hostel for the initial few days & start interacting with the localites & travelers. Understand the place first - Every city is more than a place; it's a mood, an aspiration, a tropical state of mind.

Coming back to the important question, what to do about the money ? There are several things you can do here - Best option being experiment(I am writing all that’s coming to mind right now).

Try to start a travel blog, upload videos & get in touch with travel operators if they have any sort of job for you.

Join an NGO or local school, That will give you enough money to continue your life in a decent way.

Join FB groups & post your contact details so that people coming to that place can get in touch with you directly(You have to be sure about the kind of travelers you can be more friendly with and organize tours only for them)
In a short span of time you will realize which one suits you the best.

Now we are done with one place and let’s see what all we learned in these last few months-

You know what you can do the best to earn your daily bread.

We are done with our first travel place.

We made a hell lot of friends & made more stories.(A lot of times it turns out that these friends can give you a job or at least a place to crash in there cities)

You must be thinking, what about my career ??? So what you learned here is more than a lot of us ever learn in our entire lives. You learnt the art of sales, story-telling & consulting and you learnt the skill of living a life full of adventures.

node.title: Some healthy tips for Computer Users
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
Been using computers intensely for 10 years now and have understood that if your posture is even slightly not right, you will start developing all kinds of back, wrist and neck problems very soon. Better be safe than sorry.
Some of the things that I will do very soon are:

- Stop using laptops and use more of desktops
- Wear IMAK wrist gloves for typing
- Get a standing desk
- Use only mechanical keyboards
- Use a ergonomic mouse
- Invest is a very good chair with back support.

And health wise:

- Swim everyday
- Weight training, 2-3 days a week
- Stop non-veg food completely
- 1 fruit juice a day
- Plenty of water
- Timely sleep cycle
- Less sugar where-ever possible.
- No intoxicants.

Humans were not made to sit in front of the computer and work all day. Our bodies were designed to run and hunt for food. Working on a computer is very harmful to our health in the long term.
